keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The journal cited a number of problems, including an author’s refusal to furnish raw data, with a study that claimed attitudes on same-sex marriage could be altered with brief conversations.

headline.print_headline: Study on Attitudes Toward Same-Sex Marriage Is Retracted by a Scientific Journal
headline.main: Study on Attitudes Toward Same-Sex Marriage Is Retracted by a Scientific Journal

snippet: The journal cited a number of problems, including an author’s refusal to furnish raw data, with a study that claimed attitudes on same-sex marriage could be altered with brief conversations.
abstract: Journal Science retracts study that found attitudes toward same-sex marriage can be altered by face-to-face conversations with those who care about issue; results came under fire after two graduate students discovered evidence that data had been misrepresented; lead author Donald P Green asked for study to be retracted after co-author and graduate student Michael J LaCour refused to furnish raw data.
